title: Police force refers itself to watchdog over man's death after he slashed himself in suicide attempt
text:

Cops referred themselves to the police watchdog after a man died and an officer was injured during an "attempted suicide situation." 
The man in his 30s was declared dead in hospital just hours following his self-inflicted knife injuries. 
A police officer was left with superficial slashes during the harrowing incident near Wrexham at 10.19am. 
Superintendent Alex Goss told the Daily Post : "I would like to take this opportunity to thank members of the local community for their cooperation and patience, both during and after this incident. Read More Policeman injured heroically trying in vain to stop man killing himself in street A police officer was left with superficial slashes during the harrowing incident near Wrexham (Photo: Daily post) 
"This matter is now being referred to the IPCC as is mandatory and standard procedure in these circumstances. 
"All efforts were made to save the man’s life – he was taken to hospital but subsequently died." 
North Wales Fire and Rescue Service confirmed they were asked to attend at 10.41am, but were later stood down. 
Officers shut the B5605 Ruabon Road in both directions between Brandie Brook and Stryt Las for around six hours with diversions in place while they dealt with the incident and to allow investigation work to take place. 
North Wales Police has now referred the incident to the Independent Police Complaints Commission (IPCC). Read More How to spot if barbaric dog fighting is happening near you as RSPCA warn kittens are being used as BAIT The man in his 30s slashed himself during the suicide attempt (Photo: Google) 
The Independent Police Complaints Commission is now investigating the contact officers had with the man prior to his death. 
In a statement an IPCC spokesman said it understands that North Wales Police was called to an address in Ruabon Road at around 10.20am over concerns for the welfare of a man there. He said: "It is understood that a police officer was taken to hospital with injuries although these were not thought to be serious. Officers shut the B5605 Ruabon Road in both directions between Brandie Brook and Stryt Las for around six hours (Photo: Daily post) The force has referred itself to the IPCC (Photo: Daily post) 
"After receiving notification from North Wales Police, IPCC investigators were deployed and an independent investigation was declared." 
The tragic man's family has been informed. 
IPCC Commissioner Jan Williams added: “Our thoughts are with the family of the man who died following this tragic incident. 
"We are in the initial stages of carrying out an investigation into the circumstances and the police interaction with the man. 
"We have met with his relatives to explain our role and we will keep them updated throughout our inquiries.”
